Title: Cultivating Internet Sensibility for Content Creation
Content: Internet sensibility, or 'wanggan,' is crucial for any self-media professional. It helps you capture trends, create viral content, and predict the development of events. This skill isn't innate but can be cultivated through deliberate practice. One notable figure in this field is Mimo, who has a strong internet sensibility and has created numerous viral short dramas. To develop this skill, immerse yourself in platforms like Xiaohongshu to understand their style and user preferences. Engage with trending content and analyze popular comments to grasp what resonates with the audience. Over time, you'll develop the ability to predict trends and create content that captures attention. The ultimate test of your internet sensibility is your ability to consistently produce viral content. By honing this skill, you can significantly enhance your content creation capabilities and achieve greater success in the self-media industry.

Title: Practical Methods to Enhance Internet Sensibility
Content: Enhancing your internet sensibility involves several practical methods. First, use knowledge-based apps like Fandeng Reading, Luji Thinking, and Hundun Academy to gain insights during your free time. Listening to audiobooks or industry leader speeches, such as Luo Zhenyu's 'Time's Friends,' can also be beneficial. Additionally, maintain a habit of taking notes while browsing short videos or reading books. Record catchy opening lines, high-rated comments, and interesting bullet screen comments from videos. This practice helps build a repository of ideas and enhances your ability to create engaging content. Regularly review and organize your notes to reinforce your learning. Also, pay attention to high-read articles on WeChat, trending topics on Weibo, and popular videos on Douyin and Zhihu. These platforms offer valuable insights into what captures audience interest. By consistently practicing these methods, you can develop a keen internet sensibility that aids in creating compelling and viral content.

Title: Leveraging Real-Life Experiences for Content Creation
Content: Real-life experiences are a rich source of inspiration for content creation. Pay attention to everyday interactions, advertisements, and conversations with friends to identify potential topics. For instance, interesting advertisements in elevators or catchy lyrics from songs can spark creative ideas. Keep a notebook or use your phone's memo app to jot down these inspirations. Additionally, observe what topics interest your friends during casual gatherings. Real-life stories often resonate more with audiences because they reflect genuine experiences. By grounding your content in real-life scenarios, you can create more relatable and engaging material. This approach not only enhances the authenticity of your content but also helps you connect better with your audience. Remember, the best content often stems from real-life observations and experiences. By being attentive and recording these moments, you can continuously generate fresh and impactful content ideas.
